result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Playier Jamar Houston

records.addlTxt: Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Ebony V J.

Defendant Playier Jamar Houston appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal appeared by video for Playier Jamar Houston.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Playier Jamar Houston not in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Playier Jamar Houston.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pretrial.  Defendant does not appear.  Court issued a bench warrant for the defendant's arrest.  Court forfeited $500.00 cash bail.  Jury trial date of 11-16-22 is vacated.
